Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player extends Object
The Player class represents a player in the game. This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game. A Player object stores the player's name, the current room they are in, the history of rooms they have visited, and their inventory possessing any items they may have chosen to pick up. This class provides methods to move to a new room and to return to the previous room. This class provides methods to pick up and drop items within their current room.
Version:
2025.11.17
Author:
Christian Gorosica

      public Player(String name, Room startingRoom)

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the player's name.
      Returns:
      The player's name

    • getCurrentRoom

      public Room getCurrentRoom()
      Returns the room the player is currently in.
      Returns:
      The room the player is currently in

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(Room nextRoom)
      Move the player to a new room. The current room is stored and is pushed onto the room history stack before moving.

    • goBack

      public boolean goBack()
      Moves the player back to the previous room, if possible. The last visited room is popped from the room history stack.
      Returns:
      true if the player moved back, false if there was no previous room to move into

    • takeItem

      public boolean takeItem(String itemName)
      Allows the player to take an item from the current room and place it into their inventory. If the item is not present in the room, no change occurs.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to take
      Returns:
      true if the item was successfully taken, false otherwise

    • dropItem

      public boolean dropItem(String itemName)
      Allows the player to drop an item from their inventory into the current room. If the player is not carrying the item, no change occurs.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to drop
      Returns:
      true if the item was successfully dropped, false otherwise

    • getInventoryString

      public String getInventoryString()
      Returns a string listing all items carried by the player. If the player is carrying no items, a message indicating so is returned
      Returns:
      A string representing the player's inventory contents
